title: Prints in the Art World Make Themselves Seen (and Heard) Again
description: A new exhibition at Print Center New York explores how 15 artists have used printmaking techniques since the 1970s to express their ideas about sound.
dc:creator: Laurel Graeber
category: Visual Record: The Materiality of Sound in Print (Exhibit)
media:credit: Lila Barth for The New York Times
media:description: Items on display at Print Center New York’s new exhibition, “Visual Record: The Materiality of Sound in Print,” include Jess Rowland’s “Sound Tapestries” (2022), in the foreground.
